page.title: 19ALL SAINTS' CHURCH
page.content: There has been a church on the pres- ent site since the 12th Century. The present church, formerly St Leonard's, is built of local red sandstone. It is quite a large parish church, incorpor- ating a Lady Chapel. The window behind the font is of interest as it was designed by the Vic- torian artist Burne-Jones. On the other side of the tower is a window commemor- ating Izaac Walton, a close friend of Sir John Offley, benefactor of Madeley and Lord of the Manor. On the floor of the Lady Chapel is a brass of good quality depicting members of the Egerton family. The pulpit is one of very few with a design by Dante Gabriel Rossetti. The bells of Madeley Church are still rung several times a week by a group of devoted bell-ringers.
